Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Article 1F(a) of the Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged complicity in crimes against humanity due to membership in Dev Yol
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Set aside Board's decision and refer for reconsideration
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International refugee law, principles of individual criminal responsibility
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness, correctness on questions of law
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Need for evidence of mens rea and shared common purpose
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board's decision set aside, case remanded to a differently constituted Board
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Refugee Protection Division / Refugee Appeal Division
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Mere membership not sufficient for exclusion under Article 1F(a)
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: General membership without proven active involvement
Crimes.Temporal_Context: Period of affiliation with Dev Yol
Crimes.Legal_Statute: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Serious reasons for considering the person guilty of acts contrary to the purposes and principles of the United Nations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Knowledge and personal participation required for complicity
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Not applicable – focus on exclusion grounds
Crimes.Credibility: Not directly challenged; issue centered on legal interpretation
Crimes.Targeted_Group: Civilians or groups targeted by Dev Yol’s actions
Crimes.State_Protection_Adequacy: Not assessed – matter concerned exclusion, not persecution
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Principles of international criminal law, including complicity
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Civilians affected by crimes against humanity

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Article 1F(a) of the Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged complicity in war crimes due to membership in Dev Yol
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Set aside Board's decision and refer for reconsideration
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness, correctness on points of law
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Specific evidence linking individual to war crimes or intent
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board's decision set aside, case remanded for reconsideration
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Judicial review of refugee exclusion decision
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Mere organizational membership insufficient without proof of personal involvement
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Inference based on group's conduct, lack of direct evidence
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Passive membership without demonstrated operational role
Crimes.Temporal_Context: Duration of association with Dev Yol during armed conflict
Crimes.Legal_Statute: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Geneva Conventions
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Serious reasons for suspecting commission of war crimes
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Failure to establish mens rea or shared purpose
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requirement of knowledge and intentional association with criminal acts
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Seeking refugee protection under international law
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Not evaluated – issue focused on exclusion
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Affiliation with group committing war crimes
Crimes.Credibility: Not central – decision turned on legal sufficiency
Crimes.State_Protection_Adequacy: Irrelevant – exclusion issue rather than persecution assessment
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Engagement in armed hostilities violating laws of war
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Principles of complicity under international criminal law
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Persons protected under international humanitarian law

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Article 1F(a) of the Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged complicity in crime against peace due to membership in Dev Yol
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Set aside decision and refer for reconsideration
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Demonstration of intent to participate in aggressive warfare
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision set aside, referred back for reevaluation
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Lack of personal agency in planning or initiating war
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Domestic immigration jurisdiction applying international norms
Crimes.Temporal_Context: Timeframe of Dev Yol’s belligerent activities
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Serious reasons for considering guilt in planning/initiating war of aggression
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Absence of factual analysis regarding applicant’s role
Crimes.Protected_Group: Global community (crime against peace as an international offense)
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requires high threshold of involvement in decision-making for war
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Ideological alignment with militant separatist movement
Crimes.Victim_Basis: The international community as a whole

Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Potential threat due to association with proscribed group
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Based on organization’s designation and activities
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Affiliation with Dev Yol, designated as terrorist entity
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Supportive or passive membership without evidence of violence
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Confirmed membership but no admission of violent acts
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: No evidence of radicalization or incitement
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of membership, intelligence reports
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Lack of proof of knowledge of or support for terrorism
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Partially accepted, but insufficient for exclusion
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to link individual to terrorist objectives
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Serious reasons for believing involvement in terrorism
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section related to terrorism
Crimes.Legal_Standard: More than mere membership required for exclusion
Crimes.Authority_Body: Canada Border Services Agency, CSIS, Refugee Appeal Division
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Right to fair hearing, burden of proof
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Failure to provide adequate opportunity to respond to allegations
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Lack of analysis of applicant’s knowledge and purpose
Crimes.Detention_Factors: Possibility of detention pending security assessment
